main event: A bright fireball or meteor was sighted over a large area of California on January 16, 1961, causing excitement and near-panic among witnesses.
interesting points: The fireball was visible for about 20 seconds and left a long, brilliantly-colored tail that remained visible for several minutes.
The object was witnessed by police and newspaper switchboards across a 700-mile inland area.
Residents described the object as resembling a fast-moving flaming meteor that lighted up the countryside.
Many witnesses reported that the object did not look like a typical meteor and appeared to be climbing in the sky instead of burning out.
Pieces of metal debris were found in various locations after the sighting.
sighted object: a bright fireball or meteor with a long, multicolored tail
witnesses: thousands of people, including police and newspaper staff
